intro: Tricalysia achoundongiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. Tricalysia achoundongiana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
